sentence.text: The use of low fidelity DNA polymerases in the translesional synthesis (TLS) DNA damage response pathway that repairs lesions caused by cisplatin also presents a mutational carcinogenic burden on cells that needs to be regulated by the tumor suppressor protein DNA strand renaturation.
However, there is much debate over the roles of the reversionless 3-like (error-prone translesion synthesis) protein responsible for TLS and p53 in regulating cancer cell metabolism.

In this study, the fluorescence lifetime of the metabolic coenzyme NADH reveals that the absence of error-prone translesion synthesis can promote the DNA strand renaturation-mediated upregulation of oxidative phosphorylation in cisplatin-treated H1299 lung carcinoma cells and increases cancer cell sensitivity to this platinum-based chemotherapy.

These results demonstrate a previously unrecognized relationship between DNA strand renaturation and error-prone translesion synthesis in cancer cell metabolism and may lead to improvements in chemotherapy treatment plans that reduce cisplatin resistance in lung cancer
